author: Redacción Nación
title: Entidades colombianas que experimentan con primates recibieron tremenda multa; este es el dineral que tendrán que pagar
text: A través de un comunicado de prensa, la Corporación Autónoma Regional del Valle del Cauca informó que dos entidades colombianas fueron multadas por experimentar con primates. La sanción, en conjunto, supera los mil millones de pesos. Se trata de la Fundación Centro de Primates y el Centro de Investigación Científica Caucaseco . La primera de ellas tendrá que pagar un total de $299.629.149, mientras que la segunda una suma de $799.011.065 . Este es el comunicado de prensa “La decisión convierte además en definitivo el decomiso de los primates que ahora se recuperan al cuidado de la Corporación. A ambas entidades se les impuso demás el cierre temporal y parcial de establecimiento en todo lo concerniente las labores que se relacionan y derivan de la investigación con y sobre fauna silvestre.Multas que superan los mil millones de pesos deberán enfrentar la Fundación Centro de Primates - Fucep y la sociedad Centro de Investigación Científica Caucaseco por irregularidades en el manejo de un centenar de primates que eran usados en experimentación para buscar una vacuna contra la malaria. Como se recordará la CVC recuperó y trasladó controladamente a 102 monos nocturnos Aotus sp. y 6 de Saimiri sp. o mono ardilla hacia zona rural de Palmira, en donde quedaron bajo custodia de un equipo médico veterinario de la Corporación. El operativo se hizo en compañía de la Policía, la Sijin, el Ejército y el Batallón de Desminado Humanitario No. 6. Según la Fiscalía, fue el operativo más grande de rescate de fauna que se ha hecho hasta el momentoEn ese momento, en los animales decomisados se encontraron parásitos, alteraciones en el hemograma y bioquímicas sanguíneas, asociadas al estrés y deshidratación. Además de amputaciones, fracturas antiguas y lesiones cutáneas de algunas falanges (dedos), presencia de sarro, desgaste, fracturas y ausencia de piezas en la dentadura, así como lesiones cutáneas en labios. En uno de los individuos se registró la ausencia de globo ocular. Ahora, tras seguir el debido proceso, la CVC sancionó a la Fundación Centro de Primates - Fucep con una multa por $299.629.149 y a la sociedad Centro de Investigación Científica Caucaseco con otra multa por $799.011.065. La decisión convierte además en definitivo el decomiso de los primates que ahora se recuperan al cuidado de la Corporación . A ambas entidades se les impuso además el cierre temporal y parcial de establecimiento en todo lo concerniente las labores que se relacionan y derivan de la investigación con y sobre fauna silvestre.Cabe aclarar que se trata de un fallo en primera instancia”.

author: Tommaso Bonan

author: ANI
title: 73 pc reduction in violent incidents in Northeast during PM Modi's tenure: Amit Shah in 71st Plenary Session of North Eastern Council | Headlines
text: Union Home Minister and Minister of Cooperation Amit Shah on Friday said there was a 73 per cent reduction in violent incidents in the Northeast during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's tenure. [ANI](/ani-stories)| Updated: 19-01-2024 18:47 IST | Created: 19-01-2024 18:47 IST - Country: - India Union Home Minister and Minister of Cooperation Amit Shah on Friday said there was a 73 per cent reduction in violent incidents in the Northeast during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's tenure. The Minister made the statement while addressing the 71st Plenary Session of the North Eastern Council in Meghalaya's capital Shillong, pointing that "from 2004 to 2014, a total of 11,121 violent incidents took place in the Northeast." "It declined by 73 per cent to 3,114 from 2014 to 2023," Shah said. Deaths among security forces dropped by 71 per cent from 458 to 132, while civilian deaths declined by 86 per cent, the Minister mentioned. "The incidents of insurgency have come down because more than 8,900 cadres of militant groups have surrendered in the last five years and have joined the mainstream, giving a message to the entire country that peace and prosperity are interconnected and without them, the states cannot develop." Shah added that to bring peace and stability to the Northeast, the Modi government has signed nine agreements and through these, many pending issues related to law and order have been successfully resolved. Except for some parts of Assam and Manipur, Shah also said 75 per cent of the areas covered under the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA) in 2018 have been removed from it. In his address, Amit Shah said that the last 10 years under the leadership of Prime Minister Modi have been the most significant for the development of the Northeast in the 75 years since independence. He said that in these 10 years under the leadership of Modi ji, not only the distance from Northeast to Delhi and the rest of India has reduced due to the creation of infrastructure, but the difference of hearts has also reduced. He said that the Northeast, which was struggling with various ethnic, linguistic, border and extremist groups related problems, has also reached the beginning of a fresh and durable era of peace in these 10 years. Shah said if these 10 years for the Northeast are compared with the 75 years after the country's independence, then this decade will definitely be considered the Golden period of the Northeast. He said that we have always considered the Northeast as an important part of India. During the time of Atal ji, by giving it priority, a separate ministry was created for the Northeast and today under the leadership of Prime Minister Modi, the three mantras of Act East, Act Fast and Act First are being implemented. Along with this, impetus is being given to the Northeast by giving priority to it in all the ministries of the Government of India. The Union Home Minister said that in the 50 years of its establishment, the North Eastern Council (NEC) has increased the pace of development of the region by providing a policy-related platform to all the states and simplifying the solutions to their problems. He said that in these 50 years, more than 12,000 kilometres of roads have been constructed in this region, 700 MW power plants have been established and many institutes of national excellence have also been established under the guidance of NEC. Shah added that under the leadership of Modi Ji, the role and scope of NEC have been increased under the Act East Policy. He said that in the last few years, the Modi government has achieved significant success in solving the problems of law and order, insurgency and borders in this region. Along with this, work has also been done to promote the use of technology in administration by using the North-Eastern Space Applications Centre (NESAC). He said that the language, culture, food, attire and natural beauty of the Northeast will give a great boost to this region in global tourism. Shah said that when Prime Modi came to the Plenary session of NEC in 2016, it was for the first time after 40 years that the Prime Minister of the country was presiding over this meeting. He added that after this, Modi ji visited the Northeast more than 50 times in the last 10 years and made the priorities of the government very clear to the entire country. He said that Union Ministers have also visited the Northeast more than 500 times. The Central Government, with the 'Whole of Government Approach', has not only worked to enrich the pride, languages, culture, literature, music, costumes and food of the Northeast but has also worked towards giving entire India an opportunity to get acquainted with these features. The Union Home Minister said that the Modi government has also taken many steps in the last 10 years to establish peace and stability in the Northeast. He said that the NEC Year Book - 2024 has also been released today. Shah urged all the states to control the Gross Fiscal Deficit and said that Manipur, Assam, Nagaland and Tripura have made commendable efforts in this direction. He said that we will have to give thrust to create a flood-free and drug-free Northeast and strengthen water management by using NESAC. By creating big lakes to absorb rainwater, we can attract tourism and can also strengthen the drinking water and irrigation system. Shah said that to take our criminal justice system into the 21st century, three new laws have been brought under the leadership of Modi ji and after their notification, within three years our criminal justice system will become the most modern and scientific criminal justice system in the whole world. (ANI) (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) author: Dagospia
title: i vescovi randellano il governo! la cei boccia l'autonomia differenziata: ‘rischia di minare... - Politica
text: Estratto dell’articolo di Iacopo Scaramuzzi per “la Repubblica” Il cardinale Matteo Zuppi aveva avvertito, tempo fa, che i vescovi del Sud erano «sul piede di guerra». Ora è la Conferenza episcopale tutta, da Sud a Nord, a bocciare l'autonomia differenziata, bollandola come una riforma che «rischia di minare le basi di quel vincolo di solidarietà tra le diverse Regioni, che è presidio al principio di unità della Repubblica». La Cei questa volta non si è espressa per bocca del proprio presidente — Zuppi, per dire, l'altroieri in conferenza stampa ha tirato una bordata alla riforma del premierato voluta da Giorgia Meloni — ma con una nota approvata dal consiglio episcopale permanente, ossia il «parlamentino» dei vescovi italiani. Scelta tesa a sottolineare tanto il carattere formale della presa di posizione quanto il fatto che essa sia condivisa da tutte le 226 diocesi italiane. […] «Il paese non crescerà se non insieme», afferma. I vescovi si fanno portavoce delle aree svantaggiate del paese perché «ci preoccupa — spiegano — qualsiasi tentativo di accentuare gli squilibri già esistenti tra territori, tra aree metropolitane e interne, tra centri e periferie». L'episcopato punta in particolare l'attenzione su un comparto, quello della sanità, che la Chiesa conosce bene: il rischio di una sperequazione, scrivono, «non può essere sottovalutato, in particolare alla luce delle disuguaglianze già esistenti, specialmente nel campo della tutela della salute, cui è dedicata larga parte delle risorse spettanti alle Regioni e che suscita apprensione in quanto inadeguato alle attese dei cittadini sia per i tempi sia per le modalità di erogazione dei servizi». Il ministro Calderoli aveva reagito con sorpresa già ieri, quando la Cei aveva preannunciato la pubblicazione di una nota che si annunciava critica: «Da tutti ci si poteva aspettare un pregiudizio politico», ha detto il ministro leghista, «e spiace che l'abbia assunto la Cei, peraltro a pochi giorni dal voto». […]

author: Empresa Peruana de Servicios Editoriales S. A. EDITORA PERÚ
title: Trujillo soporta persistente lluvia desde las 04:00 horas y reportan aniegos en distritos | Noticias | Agencia Peruana de Noticias Andina
text:
La provincia de Trujillo, en la región La Libertad, soporta una persistente lluvia desde las 04:00 horas de hoy viernes 29 de diciembre, que ha provocado el aniego de muchas de sus calles en los diferentes distritos de esta jurisdicción.
Sin embargo, el Centro de Operaciones de Emergencia Regional (COER) de La Libertad informó que hasta el momento no existe riesgo de activación de quebradas, y que se está monitoreando el avance de la precipitación y las cuencas para mantener informada a la población.
No obstante, el COER decidió pasar de verde a amarilla el monitoreo de las quebradas, debido a que en las primeras horas de la mañana se registraba cierta actividad en las quebradas San Ildefonso y San Carlos, pero hasta el momento todo está descartado.
Usuarios en las redes sociales han indicado que en el distrito de La Esperanza hay muchas calles anegadas, como consecuencia de la persistente lluvia.
Según el Centro Climatológico del Norte, la mayor carga de nubes con riesgo de precipitación se ha desplazado hacia la zona del centro poblado El Milagro, en el distrito de Huanchaco; así como en el distrito de La Esperanza.
Otras provincias liberteñas, como Pacasmayo, Chepén y Ascope, también se han visto afectadas por estas precipitaciones pluviales, y algunas calles registran presencia de lagunas formadas como consecuencia de las lluvias, pero no se han reportado mayores problemas hasta el momento.
Según el Senamhi, se esperan lluvias de moderada intensidad en la costa norte del país hasta el domingo 31 de diciembre del 2023.
Para las ciudades por encima de los 2,900 metros sobre el nivel del mar, se pronostican precipitaciones de hasta 25 milímetros por día que estarán acompañadas de tormentas eléctricas; así como también se prevé la presencia de granizada.
Más en Andina:
(FIN) LPZ/MAO

author: Click4r Solutions Private Limited
title: Greens at Your Doorstep: Exploring the Joy of Online Plant Nurseries | Click4R
text: In recent years, the charm of nurturing plants has blossomed into a widespread passion for many, transforming homes and gardens into vibrant oases filled with life. The convenience of online plant nurseries has made it easier than ever to explore the world of greenery from the comfort of our own homes. With just a few clicks, plant enthusiasts can discover a diverse array of flora, from rare houseplants to seasonal flowers, all delivered right to their doorstep. The rise of online plant nurseries has not only revolutionized how we acquire plants but has also created a community of gardeners eager to share their experiences and tips. For both seasoned horticulturists and beginners looking to cultivate their first indoor garden, these digital platforms offer a treasure trove of resources and choices. Whether you're nurturing a tiny succulent or dreaming of a flourishing herb garden, exploring what an online plant nursery has to offer brings the joy of gardening within reach for everyone. The Convenience of Online Shopping In today's fast-paced world, convenience is key, and online plant nurseries offer a unique solution for plant lovers and gardeners alike. With just a few clicks, you can explore a vast selection of plants, flowers, and gardening supplies from the comfort of your own home. Whether you are looking for a rare succulent or the perfect indoor houseplant, the digital shelves never seem to run out of options. This accessibility ensures that anyone, regardless of their gardening expertise, can find the right plants to suit their needs. Shopping from an online plant nursery also eliminates the challenges of traditional shopping. No more navigating through crowded garden centers or waiting in long lines. Instead, you can browse at your leisure, compare prices and care instructions, and make informed decisions without feeling rushed. Additionally, many nurseries provide detailed descriptions and care tips for each plant, allowing you to choose what works best for your space and lifestyle. This enhanced shopping experience is both user-friendly and extremely satisfying. Another advantage of online plant nurseries is the ability to have plants delivered directly to your doorstep. This means you can easily add to your collection without worrying about transportation. Delivery services often ensure that plants are packaged securely and shipped at the optimal time of year for planting. Many nurseries even offer live arrival guarantees, giving you peace of mind that your greens will arrive healthy and ready for their new home. Overall, the convenience of online shopping for plants enhances the joy of gardening and makes it more accessible to everyone. Choosing the Right Plants Selecting the right plants for your online nursery experience can be an exciting yet challenging task. Begin by considering your environment. Think about factors such as sunlight availability, humidity levels, and temperature fluctuations in your space. Understanding your local climate and the specific conditions of your home or garden will guide you in choosing plants that will thrive and flourish. Next, reflect on your level of experience and the amount of time you can dedicate to plant care. If you are a beginner or have a busy schedule, opt for low-maintenance plants that are known for their resilience and adaptability. Succulents, snake plants, and pothos are excellent choices for those starting their gardening journey. More experienced gardeners may want to explore a wider variety of plants, including those that require more specific care and attention. Lastly, think about the aesthetic you want to achieve. Consider how different plants will complement each other and fit into your existing decor. Online plant nurseries often categorize plants by themes, such as tropical, desert, or flowering varieties, making it easier to find the perfect match for your vision. Don't hesitate to explore different options and read descriptions to ensure the plants you choose will bring joy to your space for years to come. Benefits of Supporting Local Nurseries Supporting local nurseries offers a range of benefits that extend beyond the individual shopper. Firstly, buying from local nurseries contributes to the community's economy. When you choose to purchase plants from a nearby source, you are helping to create jobs and strengthen local business. This flow of money within the community can lead to improved local services and investments in public spaces, making the neighborhood a better place to live for everyone. Secondly, local nurseries often provide plants that are well-suited to the regional climate and soil conditions. Knowledgeable staff at these nurseries can offer valuable advice tailored to local needs, such as plant selection, care, and pest management. This personalized service enhances the likelihood of gardening success, fostering a deeper connection between the gardener and their plants. This relationship can lead to a more vibrant community garden culture. Lastly, supporting local nurseries promotes environmental sustainability. By sourcing plants locally, customers can reduce the carbon footprint associated with transporting plants over long distances. Many small nurseries also prioritize eco-friendly practices, such as organic gardening techniques and sustainable sourcing of materials. This commitment not only benefits the immediate environment but also encourages a broader movement toward responsible gardening practices that preserve nature for future generations.

author: Business Wire
title: Carnegie Mellon University's Feinberg Lab's FRESH bioprinting technique brings vascularized tissue one step closer | News | bakersfield.com
text:
PITTSBURGH--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Apr 23, 2025--
Collagen is well-known as an important component of skin, but its impact is much greater, as it is the most abundant protein in the body, providing structure and support to nearly all tissues and organs. Using their novel Freeform Reversible Embedding of Suspended Hydrogels (FRESH) 3D bioprinting technique, which allows for the printing of soft living cells and tissues, Carnegie Mellon’s Feinberg lab has built a first-of-its-kind microphysiologic system, or tissue model, entirely out of collagen. This advancement expands the capabilities of how researchers can study disease and build tissues for therapy, such as Type 1 diabetes.
